complaint processing complaint processing purpose:

description of the procedure for handling complaints if quality-relevant deviations are identified in the product / process. the aim is to eliminate the reason for the complaint as quickly and effectively as possible and to avoid a recurrence of the defect. in addition, the complete documentation of the problem solution should ensure the traceability of the fault elimination process.

area of application:

this description applies to 
- for all locations of iwis engine systems worldwide. 
- only for complaints which are triggered by product or process-related quality defects from prototyp-phase pre-series, series and warranty.
- for complaints that must be processed using the 8d procedure. (in the case of prototype, pre-series and warranty claims, not all steps of the 8d procedure must necessarily be carried out).
 
if the customer only requests an informal statement without detailed analysis or 8d report, the feedback can be given by e-mail / presentation, and no complaint must be recorded in babtec.

processing complaints processing complaints definitions: babtec: caq system, incl. modules for complaint and action management. 8d report: the 8d report documents the complaint process in a clearly summarized way together with the corresponding corrective actions. it is created by an 8d team. complaint handler: responsible employee of the qm organization who starts the new complaint process, creates it in babtec and follows it to the end. the complaint handler varies depending on the complaint type (such as customer, field, supplier, internal or intercompany complaint). he ensures the correct documentation of complaint processing in the caq system and ensures that deadlines are met. he is part of the 8d team and methodically supports teamwork as an 8d moderator. ccm: (customer complaint manager): complaint handler responsible for customer complaints. supplier: in the sense of this work instruction, a supplier of both internal and external products and / or services. customer: is in the sense of this work instruction both internal and external customer of products and / or services. a defect is the non-compliance with the specified requirements. the non-conformity of the product / process (the defect) is detected either at incoming inspection or after the last process step (final inspec-tion in production, in the product audit, in downstream areas or in the worst case at the customer), and thus triggers a complaint. repeated defect: defined under the following condi-tions: 1. the same part (base: part number) 2. the complaint went to the same (int. / ext.) supplier. 3. both complaints have the same error symptom (basis: error description of the customer). 4 the first complaint about this combination has al-ready been completed. if all four conditions apply, this is a case of a repeating defect. follow-up defect: if the conditions 1.-3. of a repeating defect are true, but the first complaint is not yet closed.

iwis strategy process iwis strategy process
evidence documents retrieval evidence documents retrieval evidence documents can be found on the oems supplier portal. login information can be found in the warranty handbook (chapter 9).

customer specific data processing customer specific data processing for customer specific data processing, the oem¬¥s raw data is formated in a way that can be imported into babtec. specific rules can be found in the warranty handbook chapter 9

babtec import & data processing babtec import & data processing processed data in .csv format, together with further evidence if available, are imported into babtec and processed further. for example, this processing includes matching customer to iwis parts numbers. further information can be found in the warranty handbook chapter 8

data validation data validation for data validation, data in babtex is validated based on specified rules. objection criteria for example are out of warranty, missing case data (vin, registration date, mileage, error code,...) or unplausible entries (i.e. mileage too high, production date past registration date, etc.). babtec automatically creates an objection list with all rejectable claims. further information can be found in the warranty handbook chapter 8.

o.c: send list of objections to customer + preliminary information

i.o: send list of objections to customer + preliminary information send list of objections to customer + preliminary information in this step, objection is given to the unjustified advance information. contact persons at the oem, deadlines and further information can be found in the warranty handbook chapter 9.

further analysis & developing arguments further analysis & developing arguments if the customer is not willing to change his claim based on provided documents (objection list), further analysis is necesarry to strengthen iwis¬¥ position. further analysis options can be found in the warranty handbook chapter 4.

check corrected evidence documents check corrected evidence documents in this step, corrected evidence documents are validated once more. rules are identical with initial validation steps. further information can be found in the warranty handbook chapter 8.
post evidence documents post evidence documents evidence documents are posted in sap to the relevant cost centers

provide data for q-cockpit provide data for q-cockpit based on the analyses, warranty kpis are calculated to allow kpi-based process control. e.g. number of new claims per customer, rejected/accepted claim ratio, warranty rate, top error pattern. warranty kpis can be found in the warranty handbook chapter 6.

o.c: Handover of recommendation for supplier nomination to purchasing

i.o: handover of recommendation for supplier nomination to purchasing handover of recommendation for supplier nomination to purchasing

extended data analysis extended data analysis during extended data analysis, all available information on field performance is analysed further. pivotanalyses to isolate critical markets, customers, regions, sesions, etc. are made. furthermore, parts that showed anomalies during previous analyses are examines more thoroughly by for examaple layered line graphs, weibull analysis, stress analysis or reliability prediction. analysis methods, necessary software and tips for data analysis can be found in the warranty handbook chapters 3, 4 and 5.
summon in-field failure council summon in-field failure council the leader qm cann decide for an unplanned intervention by the in-field failure if necessary.

establish task force establish task force if an escalation is necessary (e.g. recall, serial damange, etc.), establishing a task force ensures that interdisciplinary know-how is available and that the case can be dealt with with regards to liability and financial factors. structure of the task force, suggested procedures, actions, checklist and tips can be found in the warranty handbook chapter 3-5

coordinate further actions with customer coordinate further actions with customer if information of the customer is necessary for safety and escalation reasons, or to get more data, further actions need to be coordination. especially communication rules need to be follower to prevent undapproved information from being spread. further data analysis, statistics, etc. are done in close contact with the customer. suggested procedures, chec lists and guide can be found in the warranty hand book.

o.c: document Lessons Learned, PEP und Produktion

i.o: document lessons learned, pep und produktion document lessons learned, pep und produktion after a claim is succesfully closed, it is archived in iwis¬¥ lessons learned database. a short summary of the claim incl. what went good, what went bad helps prevent similar problems in the future
finish claim processing finish claim processing

check products for ntf-criteria check products for ntf-criteria first, data is searched for ntf criteria accoriding to iwis ntf-guidelines (incl. oem requirements). this includes for example reaching defined ntf-quotas, in-field problems after production start-up or significant problems for the end user (e.g. break downs). results are documented in ntf-reports according to the template. further information can be found in the warranty handbook chapter 2.

initiate ntf-project initiate ntf-project ist eine ntf-projekt durchzuf√ºhren, wird durch den warranty mitarbeiter auf dem server ein projektordner erstellt, in dem folgende unterstruktur vorliegt: - kommunikation - daten iwis - daten oem - daten externe quellen - analysen die benennung von ordnern, dokumenten etc. richtet sich nach dem leitfaden ntf-prozess iwis aus dem gew√§hrleistungshandbuch.

collect product specific data collect product specific data during this process step, all available information regarding the ntf-process are collected. with this, product and process related analyses are possible. examples for this are: warrantydata from the oem, sales numbers, vehicle information incl. service and repair instructions, diagnostics result. online forum and internet search, information about the production process, dvp, sector and competitor benchmarks, lessons learned from fmeas. further information can be found in the warranty handbook chapter 2.

develop ntf-process strategy develop ntf-process strategy in this step, materials, methods and the people involved in the ntf-process are defined. technical an personal capacaties need to be estimated and requested. if it can be assumed that the faulty part was cause/influenced by the customer, he needs to be included in the process. this is epecially important when test-equipment, test cars and the service net has to be provided by the sucotmer

include oem in ntf-process include oem in ntf-process ist die mitarbeit des kunden/oem erforderlich, so muss er unter mitteilung der bisher ausgearbeiteten strategie aufgefordert werden, sich am ntf-prozess zu beteiligen. im rahmen der dann folgenden absprachen m√ºssen gemeinsame datenanalysen, schadteilanalysen und weitere, je nach fall notwendige, ma√ünahmen abgestimmt werden. sollten oem-spezifische anforderungen existieren, so sind diese im rahen des ntf-prozesses zu ber√ºcksichtigen. oem-anforderungen abweichend vom vda ntf-prozess finden sich im gw-handbuch kapitel 2.9 besonderheiten ntf-prozess der einzelnen oem. if the customers assistance is required, he ist required to assist in the ntf-process. if the customer has specific requirements for the process they need to be fullfilled,oem requirements deviating from vda mtf can be found in the warranty handbook chapter 2.9.

follow ntf-checklist follow ntf-checklist once the strategy is decided on, the ntf-process is executed according to the ntf-checklist. the results are documented in the ntf checklist and the ntf report. detailed information about the testing method, statisctical methods, etc. are to be saved in the respective sub-folder of the ntf project. intermittent results are to be shared with the customer on a regular basis.

write ntf report ntf-bericht erstellen after completion of the ntf-process, relevant results are compiled into a report and sent to the customer. further handling of the damaged parts is customer specific.

audit preparation audit preparation process audit in accordance with vda 6.3 - used in production - only vda 6.3 - p6 is audited. customer specific requirement vw: - additional formul q f√§higkeiten, appendix 8 must be considered.
perform internal audit perform internal audit
check root cause analysis check root cause analysis
determine effectiveness check determine effectiveness check

root cause analysis root cause analysis an appropriate root cause analysis must be carried out for each deviation. f183 problem solving methods can be used as an aid here. the cause analysis for the respective deviation must be stored in the babtec audit module - either in the provided fields or with the help of the f183. period for creation the cause analysis including measures should be prepared promptly. a reasonable period of time is one week. --> the time schedule for the processing of the measures to the deviations begins with the day of the audit!
execute action plan execute action plan
check effectiveness of audit programm check effectiveness of audit programm
report audit planning at qmr report audit planning at qmr

evaluation & report generation @babtecaudit evaluation & report generation @babtecaudit the evaluation of the audit is based on the evaluation criteria provided in the babtec questionnaire. for process audits according to vda 6.3, the specifications for evaluation from the vda volume must be observed. if possible, objective evidence of the deviations should be collected and filed in babtecaudit. for this purpose, documents can be scanned or photos taken in the audit. the following applies to the classification of deviations: majornc whole sections of the standard or the own qm-documentation, which are the basis of the audit, were not processed or during an activity in the company requirements of the standard / the qm-documentation are systematically not used. minornc a single nonconformity from the requirements. a number of minor nonconformities from a specific requirement can be classified as a major deviation. potential/recommendation improvement suggestion discovered by the auditor in the process. send report the report including deviations must be sent to the audited process owner promptly after the audit. the director qms must be set to cc.

start a complaint start a complaint the triggered complaint should be recorded according to the trigger matrix (wi-31.003-gen) in babtec.

receive complaint / understand problem receive complaint / understand problem complaints about products which have not yet been approved by iwis (in case of purchased part) or by the customer (prototype or pre-series part) will be handled in full by the responsible project quality engineer.

the responsibility for processing complaints is transferred to the responsible complaint handler after the initial sample approval by the customer. the handover takes place during the qm series introduction discussion (see checklist f321) between project and plant quality as well as ccm.
in the series start-up phase (up to qg5), the project team (project manager, project quality engineer, design engineer and, if necessary, systems engineer) should be involved in complaints processing. later, it is sufficient if only the project quality engineer is in-formed about the (customer) complaint and if necessary involved in the processing.

initiate complaint processing (8d process) initiate complaint processing (8d process) specific requirements from the respective customer regarding documentation of complaints processing must always be taken into account. 

complaints must be recorded and processed in babtec.

after receiving the message about non-conformity, the responsible complaint responsible starts the complaint processing procedure (create a new complaint in babtec complaints module). select the complaint type according to wi-31.003-gen. >> see also the actual babtec training materials.

only one defect or one part number may be listed under a complaint number. complaints concerning several defects on the same product, or several products with the same defect pattern must be created under different complaint numbers, whereby these complaints can be linked with each other. (exception: field complaints, here several part numbers can be entered under one complaint number).¬†

when creating a new complaint, the complaint responsible must check the error for repetition. repeat errors must be marked accordingly in babtec.

start supplier complaint (create) start supplier complaint (create) supplier complaints are handled by the responsible complaints handler. if required, supplier development or project quality department from d5 onwards is to be integrated for a plausibility check of the cause analysis and the defined action plan, as well as for an effectiveness check of the implemented actions on site. in case of escalation, the purchasing department must also be involved.

the supplier is informed about the complaint with a standard letter. see template in babtec (print menu on articel level).

create a problem-solving team (d1) create a problem-solving team (d1) complaint responsible = 8d moderator / method expert
causer = team leader (prozess responsible)

during the processing of complaints the causer-pays principle prevails, however the 8d procedure is always based on interdisciplinary teamwork. the composition of the 8d team (iwis intern) and the roles within the team are regulated in attachment #2 of wi-31.003-gen.

o.c: Support of complaint processing as 8D moderator

i.o: support of complaint processing as 8d moderator support of the internal complaint processing as 8d moderator

communication with the customer communication with the customer if the complaints processing for the external customer has to be documented in a customer portal (b2b), it must be maintained by the responsible complaints handler in accordance with the set deadline.

evaluate feedback from the causer evaluate feedback from the causer of the problem the output of the 8d problem solving method is the fully completed 8d report, supplemented, if necessary, by various support and evidence documents.
if the complaint handler or the customer does not agree with the contents of the 8d report or if it is not complete, the causer (e.g. supplier or production) or the 8d team must initiate its improvement.

an evaluation table is available as an aid to the respective complaint handler and the 8d team to check and evaluate the quality of the 8d procedure during the complaint processing or before the conclusion of the 8d report (see evaluation matrix in f183).

the open complaint in babtec must be kept up to date by the 8d team throughout the entire processing period. all relevant information and files must be stored in babtec (including feedback from external suppliers).

8d reports from suppliers must also be filed in babtec. in this case, the basic information from the 8d report (such as immediate measures, cause, counter- and preventive measures with the deadlines) shall be transferred to babtec in accordance with the defined tree structure.
demanding information from the causer demand information from the polluter, if necessary have the 8d report corrected

close complaint in babtec (d8) close complaint in babtec (d8) and record costs see deadline specifications in wi-31.003gen.

all relevant costs incurred in connection with the processing of complaints shall be recorded in babtec and will be charged afterwards by fi according to the causer.

note: in germany, customer complaints and related supplier complaints are closed by the head of warranty and customer complaints.

stages, tasks and responsibilities definition of stages, tasks and responsibilities the change committee, the requester and the departments define the change implementation. the following are determined jointly: overall person responsible, work packages with target dates and responsible persons. the implementation of changes is structured according to the requirements, not necessarily according to standard phases.

the standard phases of a change are:
- planning: here all information necessary for the evaluation and planning of the changes by the change committee is obtained.
- feasibility: here the feasibility of a change is examined.
- validation: this phase serves to prove the suitability of modified parts or processes.
- introduction: in this phase, the change is introduced into series production (usually by means of f098 by the project team).

organize kick-off meeting organize kick-off meeting as described in the 8d problem solving method in d1 (see also appendix 1 of wi-31.003-gen), the complaint handler must create a kick-off meeting after the complaint has been received. 

for this purpose, the team members of the prospective 8d team from the respective departments must be invited. see attachment 2 of wi-31.003-gen.

the kick-off meeting is used for the ex-change of information, the possible expansion and concretization of the 8d team and the initial distribu-tion of tasks. these could be, for example, tracing and narrowing down the problem, checking the delivery schedules and the inventory, and initiating immediate measures.

escalation of critical issues escalation of critical issues the following risk levels are defined for all complaint types:

risk c:
- risk level green: low risk
- action: normal complaint processing (day-to-day business)
- responsible: complaints responsible
- reporting: weekly report

risk b:
- risk level yellow: medium risk
- action: escalation to supervisor, who introduces an escalation meeting with the next higher organizational levels of the affected areas to find a solution. vp quality management is informed of the escalation. if a decision is required, the issue is presented in the q round (if the originator is iwis), and other q managers may be involved.
- responsible: supervisor of the complaint responsible
- reporting: weekly report 

risk a:
- risk level red: high risk 
- action: escalation to vp quality management, who introduces an escalation meeting with the next higher organizational levels of the affected areas to find a solution. if necessary, the gf as well as customer internal service / purchasing must be informed about the escalation.
- responsible: vp quality management
- reporting: weekly report, one-pager
